title.narrative: OUTPUT 10.4 CAPACITY DEVLEOPMENT Communication for Development (C4D)

description.narrative: Output 10.4: Communication for Development (C4D) strategies effectively guide programme implementation and/or upstream programme/policy advocacy in both sector and cross-cutting results in priority areas for normative, social and behavior change, and community engagement., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 9: Programme support is efficient, effective, risk informed and according to ethical standards to enable the Country Programme achieve results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 10.4: C4D strategies effectively guide programme implementation and/or upstream programme/policy advocacy in both sectorand cross-cutting results in priority areas for normative, social and behavior change, and community engagement.

description.narrative: Through implementing partners, sustained strategic evidence-based Social and Behaviour Change (SBC), as well as Risk Communication and Community Engagement (RCCE) interventions, were designed and implemented to address the needs of vulnerable communities during responses to preventable disease outbreaks, including COVID-19, Cholera/AWD, Measles and Polio. About 10.7 million people were engaged in key lifesaving practices to facilitate social and behavior change, increase demand for basic health and nutrition services, and promote empowerment as well as community-led accountability across programmatic areas. Evidence generation initiatives including10 studies and assessments on behaviors and social norms were conducted to inform decisions in various programmatic. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:12/01/2022
